name: italianate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of buildings, gardens, etc.) designed in a traditional Italian style: The Italianate facade will be retained as part of any future development. At the back lies an Italianate garden, complete with palisade and classical statues in bronze.
typical of, or found in, Italy: I have had schnitzel before, and have had difficulty separating the German variety from its Italianate cousin, veal milanese. Their clothes are branded with Italianate names such as Armando, Zantos and Louis Gianni.
More examplesFewer examplesThe walls are painted in terracotta tones, and the tiled floor gives it a bustling, vaguely Italianate feel.Cliveden, that great Italianate mansion beside the Thames, has always been a hotbed of intrigue and scandal. Her father started creating the Italianate village of Portmeirion in 1925.Mireille brought to her life's work all that she had received through her father's Italianate family.Try this snappy cake recipe with Italianate influences.
